result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Sia R S P Kyesi was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse after 2 years of his sentence is served.
Victim Impact Panel meeting was completed.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL APPLIED OF $465.00. Remaining balance of Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
BAIL APPLIED. Blood costs PAID IN FULL. To be forwarded to the Waukesha Co. Sheriff's Dept.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - (nonworking hours) COMMENCE FORTHWITH. The First 210 days jail are with Huber. Standard release including for work, school, treatment and childcare. The last 155 days jail are STAYED and the defendant to be released from Huber to Day Report Center for compliance for 155 days.

AS OF 9/23/2015: Sentence may be transferred to Milwaukee County. NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
Defendant to served 50 hours PER EACH YEAR of Probation, as a Condition of Probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sia R S P Kyesi

records.addlTxt: Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

records.addlTxt:
From WCS dated 6/24/16 re dendant's successful completion of DRC. 
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 6/29/16.
From WCS dated 5/6/16 re supervision will be stayed while defendant travels out of state until 5/8/16.
From WCS dated 1/12/16 re SCRAM removed and double enhanced supervision.  Defendant refused to submit documentation to DRC for reduction in SCRAM.

Filed by Attorney Ehrfurth requesting the Defendant be allowed to serve the Huber portion of the sentence in Milwaukee County.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian and transfer permitted to Milwaukee so long as electronic monitoring not a condition of the transfer.
Associated with Charge #1
from Behavior Health Services filed by Defense
Certificate filed
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Sia R S P Kyesi in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Barbara Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed by operation of law. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 6 years (Initial Confinement: 3 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years)  Stayed for 3 years Probation
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program after 2 years of his sentence is served. 
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting has been complied with
- Alcohol Assessment 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department - append to fine.. 
- Fine totaling: $2312.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - apply bail
- DNA Surcharge is waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.   
- Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service per each year of probation as a Condition of Probation
- 1 year jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing forthwith. The 1st 210 days jail are with huber.  Non-working hours with standard release conditions - including work, school, treatment and childcare.   
The last 155 days jail are STAYED and the defendant to be released from Huber to Day Report Center for compliance for 155 days.  
Defendant was remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to commence the sentence.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program within 1 business day of his release. Defendant must sign a $2500.00 signature bond and post $500.00 cash bail.
